content: 12000 species by catherine djimramadji a giant moss stitch boomerang-shaped shawl with eyelet colour changes a few short row for maximum wingspan and a picot edging that marries with the delicious texture of all-over moss stitch do not knit if you hate moss stitch but if the gentle rhythm of it pleases you this is a comforting shawl to wear and a satisfying one to make materials this can be made with any weight of yarn you like the original calls for 4ply yarns of your choosing- the sample used 250g 5x50g skeins you could use more colours find or create a gradient work with handspun yarn or pick one or two colours the eyelet colour change row could be worked more often if you don t have actual colour changes that require them this is a very flexible recipe rather than a fixed pattern 250g gave me a wingspan along the top edge of 2 7m but you can stop at any point needles the important thing is to end up with a fabric and texture that you like i found that moss stitch and a woollen-spun yarn could take quite a large needle size 4mm for 4ply yarn and this gave the drape that i desired the shawl begins with only a few stitches so if you wish to trial a yarn and needle size rather than knitting a separate swatch that is possible abbreviations k knit p purl kfb knit front and back increase 1 k2tog knit two stitches together decrease sl1 slip a stitch purlwise with the yarn in front yo yarnover increase w&t wrap and turn work until the pattern says to stop slip the next stitch purlwise over to the right hand needle bring the yarn between the needles to the front slip the stitch on the right hand needle back onto the left hand needle bring the yarn back between the needles to the back then turn your knitting pattern cast on 7 stitches row 1 kfb k1 p1 k1 p1 k2tog row 2 sl1 p1 k1 p1 k1 kfb sl1 row 3 kfb *k1 p1 to last three stitches k1 k2tog row 4 sl1 *k1 p1 to last three stitches k1 kfb sl1 row 5 kfb *k1 p1 to last two stitches k2tog row 6 sl1 *p1 k1 to last two stitches kfb sl1 repeat row 3-6 until you wish to change colour or until you wish to insert an eyelet row eyelets in current colour kfb *yo k2tog to last two stitches k2tog if you find you have three stitches remaining work k1 k2tog next row sl1 k to last two stitches kfb sl1 repeat these two row in the new colour repeat the moss stitch and eyelet sections until you have used approximately 80% of your yarn or you join your final colour short row maintaining the pattern as established work short row as follows rs kfb work in pattern until approximately five stitches remain
